abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Liaoning Urban Transport
            Project for China were as follows: the outcome was
            satisfactory, the sustainability was likely, the
            institutional development impact was modest, and the Bank
            and borrower performance were both satisfactory. Lessons
            learned from the project: A transport strategy endorsed by
            the city is essential to provide a framework for
            investments. Political risk is not easy to assess or guard
            against. Sensitization of key decision makers is crucial for
            successful implementation of urban transport innovations.
            Foreign consultants should be selected for tasks for which
            the Borrower recognizes a clear value added. Traffic
            management concepts require a process that should involve
            testing and adaptation before it can be fully implemented or
            expanded. There is an inherent priority given to road
            construction and improvement that hinders the development of
            public transport. Knowledge transfer and institutional
            development is a long process.

abstracts.cdata!:
The Liaoning Urban Transport Project
            seeks to a) alleviate bottlenecks in the road system; b)
            increase efficiency and effectiveness of public transport
            services; c) improve maintenance of road investments; d)
            improve environmental sustainability of project investments;
            e) improve operational efficiency and safety of the road
            system; and f) strengthen local capacity for urban transport
            system management. The project will support the development
            of infrastructure, services, and institutions in the cities
            of Shenyang, Fushun, and Anshan. In Shenyang, the project
            will augment the existing urban road network through the
            construction of additional capacity in the principal
            east-west corridors, provide additional crossings of the
            railways lines, provide exclusive bus lanes, and strengthen
            local capacity for the management of urban transport
            operations and services through studies, technical
            assistance, and training. In Fushun, the project will
            finance the construction of the Hunhenan Corridor, the
            provision of bus priority facilities and non-motorized
            vehicle exclusive roads, and support studies, technical
            assistance, and training. In Anshan, the project will
            finance the reconstruction of the main north-south corridor
            and the construction of an interchange between the primary
            north-south and east-west corridors. The project will also
            support the development of selected sector institutions in
            the three cities.

repnme.cdata!:
China - Liaoning Urban Transport Project :
            environmental assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
The Liaoning Urban Transport Project
            (LUTP) will consist of public transportation, transportation
            management, infrastructure development, road maintenance,
            and institutional strengthening in Shenyang, Anshan, and
            Fushun. The report looks at the following environmental
            impacts and mitigation: air quality, noise & vibration,
            surface water pollution, sunshine obstruction, soil &
            vegetation, social-economic impacts, and resettlement. Major
            mitigation measures to be undertaken include: construction
            of sound barriers, and sound absorption pavement;
            installation of double glazed windows and air conditioners;
            promotion of public transportation, clean fuels, vehicle
            inspection, and maintenance programs; installation of street
            crossing signals, zebra lines, and designated non-motor
            vehicle lanes; re-plantation and landscaping programs;
            interception of surface runoff; and establishment of
            environmental emergency teams to minimize impacts of motor
            vehicle accidents involving hazardous materials. Remaining
            noticeable impacts include an increase in noise; loss of
            agricultural land; temporary traffic obstruction and
            detouring; and accidental hazardous material release.

China - Liaoning Urban Transport Project :

TF036204-CHINA - GUANGZHOU CITY CENTRE PROJECT,TF035149-CHINA - LIANING URBAN TRANSPORT PROJECT,TF034992-CHINA - TRI PROVINCIAL HIGHWAY PROJECT,TF034791-CHINA - GUANGZHOU CITY CENTER
            TRANSPORT, LIAONING URBAN TRANSPORT,TF034185-CHINA - LIAONING URBAN
            TRANSPORT PROJECT,TF025511-PHRD-LIAONING PROVINCIAL URBAN

repnme.cdata!:
China - Liaoning Urban Transport Project :
            environmental assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
The Liaoning Urban Transport Project
            (LUTP) will consist of public transportation, transportation
            management, infrastructure development, road maintenance,
            and institutional strengthening in Shenyang, Anshan, and
            Fushun. The report looks at the following environmental
            impacts and mitigation: air quality, noise & vibration,
            surface water pollution, sunshine obstruction, soil &
            vegetation, social-economic impacts, and resettlement. Major
            mitigation measures to be undertaken include: construction
            of sound barriers, and sound absorption pavement;
            installation of double glazed windows and air conditioners;
            promotion of public transportation, clean fuels, vehicle
            inspection, and maintenance programs; installation of street
            crossing signals, zebra lines, and designated non-motor
            vehicle lanes; re-plantation and landscaping programs;
            interception of surface runoff; and establishment of
            environmental emergency teams to minimize impacts of motor
            vehicle accidents involving hazardous materials. Remaining
            noticeable impacts include an increase in noise; loss of
            agricultural land; temporary traffic obstruction and
            detouring; and accidental hazardous material release.

docna.cdata!:
China - Liaoning Urban Transport Project :
            environmental assessment

China - Liaoning Urban Transport
            Project : environmental assessment (Vol. 7)
